page.title: 03HOMES IN 1985.
page.content:
The homes in 1985 are made out of wood, bricks and metal. Bricks are the main structure of the home. Tiles, made out of slate or clay are on the roofs of many houses .
Different fuels used include gas and electricity. A home in 1985 might have three bedrooms, one bathroom, one toilet, a kitchen, a lounge and a dining room. Some homes have gardens some have a garage. The different homes you can get are bungalows, cottages, flats and private or council houses. A typical terrace house might cost about 45 thousand pounds.
Electrical equipment in the home might be a video, a t.v., a microwave, a washing machine, a stereo, a fridge, a freezer, an oven, dishwasher, a record player, a telephone and a computer.
